meanings.definition: The outer layer of a cell or organism.
meanings.sent1: The ectosarcs of the cell protect it from harm.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the ectosarcs of different organisms to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The tiny organism wore its ectosarcs like a suit of armor.
meanings.sent4: The ectosarcs of the cell acted as a shield against external threats.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the ectosarcs made the cell stand out under the microscope.

meanings.definition: The outermost layer of a cell membrane.
meanings.sent1: The ectosarcs of the cell membrane regulate what enters and exits the cell.
meanings.sent2: Damage to the ectosarcs of the cell membrane can affect its function.
meanings.sent3: The cell membrane's ectosarcs were like the gates of a castle, controlling passage in and out.
meanings.sent4: The ectosarcs of the cell membrane are like the border patrol, monitoring traffic in and out.
meanings.sent5: The delicate nature of the ectosarcs in the cell membrane requires careful handling during experiments.
